content: Oh wow, thank you for such a swift answer and sorry for failing to find it.
cognivore has marked this topic as resolved.
It's actually interesting... I've been searching with rg -i 'string.*bytearray' and rg -i 'bytearray.*string', but failed to find.

cognivore said:

Should get better at searching.

sure, you could, but I don't think that's too much on you. It's hard to search by strings like that. We'd need something like hoogle or even better hoogle+. Just someone needs to implement that :sweat_smile: It's on my (very long and unrealistic) list of things I'd like to do when I have the time, but I wouldn't hold my breath on that one.

Hoogle like search is on the lower end of my doc-gen prio list right now as well. After I got the LeanInk integration in a good state (which will take some time) I was planning to try and get to that as well
I think we already do have an okay basis for this with mathlib.find though. Its just that someone has to do it :tm:
